stream_context.summary: Kaze live-debugs a crash, rebuilds a red-coin side area, tweaks visuals (textures, fog, lighting) and discusses future Course 13 while chatting about fitness, doctors and philosophy.
level: Temple side-area (Course unknown, in-game flame temple)

development_findings.summary: A crash on entering the new area was traced to an optimisation that stored the current object pointer in the FP/S8 register, which a swimming function overwrote; recompiling to avoid S8 removed the crash.
development_findings.quote: Basically the bug is it's using the S8 register… my current object pointer gets overwritten if you're swimming.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is replacing the ‘boring red-coin mission’ with a new temple sub-area featuring vertical movement, sliding coins and moving brick platforms; the old layout will be cut.
development_findings.quote: We're just remaking one area of an old level because I watched play-testers play it and realised this area fucking sucks.

development_findings.summary: Moving brick platforms now have scuffed textures and fog to blend with the temple set-piece after Biobak’s visual feedback.
development_findings.quote: I made it scuffed and it now has fog, so it looks less out of place.

development_findings.summary: Quest 13 is planned as a bright, desaturated ice castle atop a mountain, inspired by Hollow Root Keep from The Missing Link; no boss design yet.
development_findings.quote: Quest 13 is going to be an ice castle on top of a mountain… white and desaturated blues.

development_findings.summary: Per-area water splash colours are on the feature list to improve visual feedback.
development_findings.quote: Per area splash colors are planned.

development_findings.summary: The engine for Return to Yoshi’s Island will be released as open source.
development_findings.quote: Will the engine be open source? Yes it will be.

development_findings.summary: Lighting consistency across courses is actively tracked; Kaze read out the current light/dark/sunset distribution.
development_findings.quote: Lightning looks for courses are as follows…

development_findings.summary: Progress on F3DEX3 and RQIA (graphics/engine tech) is stalled until Sauraen makes final decisions.
development_findings.quote: I'm still waiting for Sauraen to make the final decisions on that.

context_findings.summary: Kaze works out almost daily, benches 243 lbs on stream equipment and aims for a 400 lb bench; current knee injury limits squats.
context_findings.quote: I work out like almost every day… my squat has really fallen behind because my knee injury has been there all the time.

context_findings.summary: His haircut was accidently shaved short by Zeina when the clipper guard fell off.
context_findings.quote: My wife fucked up my haircut… there was a whole bald line here so we had to cut it short.

context_findings.summary: He predicts future moral backlash against meat eating yet still eats meat, reflecting on immortality and societal judgement.
context_findings.quote: Personally, I think that people that eat meat nowadays… in a few years they will be looked at like the worst people ever.

context_findings.summary: He distrusts doctors after unhelpful experiences and prefers self-directed physiotherapy and research.
context_findings.quote: Every time I go to a doctor it gets worse, so I do not go to doctors anymore.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values open debate and sees arguing as a path to learning, distancing from platforms that shut down ‘political’ talk.
context_findings.quote: I like arguing about everything, because when you argue you learn more about other ways of thinking.

biobak.summary: Provided design feedback on Wild West level structures and platform texturing, leading Kaze to change brick visuals and consider wood accents.
biobak.quote: Changing this to something structure related would be a good idea.

zeina.summary: Created new Wild West signage textures (Tumbleweed Store, Koopa Bank, Milk Bar) and is currently ‘upstairs working on the mod’.
zeina.quote: Oh yeah, Zeina also makes textures… she also made two other ones.

zeina.summary: Accidentally gave Kaze a very short ‘military’ haircut when the clipper guard slipped.
zeina.quote: She was using the clippers… the front thing came off and she just kept going.

key_stories.title: The S8 Register Crash
key_stories.summary: A severe crash occurred whenever Mario hit a wall in the new area. Kaze traced it to an aggressive register optimisation that collided with GCC’s use of S8.
key_stories.challenge: Area crashed on entry and wall-hits.
key_stories.process: Reviewed assembler, identified that the current object pointer lived in S8/FP; reduced register pressure so compiler stopped using S8.
key_stories.outcome: Recompiled, confirmed ‘one bug gone’. Area now stable.
key_stories.key_quote: By my calculations, we should now be rid of the crash.

key_stories.title: Red-Coin Area Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Play-testing showed the existing red-coin mission was boring and camera-unfriendly. Kaze decided to scrap it live and redesign a more dynamic temple segment.
key_stories.challenge: Original mission was cute but not fun; poor camera and waiting segments.
key_stories.process: Removed old geometry, designed vertical jumps, sliding coin setup, split the space, adjusted collisions.
key_stories.outcome: New layout nearly finished with improved flow; visual polish underway.
key_stories.key_quote: This area fucking sucks… we're just remaking it.

key_stories.title: Envisioning Quest 13
key_stories.summary: Kaze reveals the next major course will be a suspenseful ice castle inspired by his own Zelda mod. Colour palette will be bright whites and desaturated blues, not night-time.
key_stories.challenge: Need a fresh thematic direction after current side-area.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed live, compared lighting balance across game, cited influence from Hollow Root Keep.
key_stories.outcome: Concept locked; boss fight still undecided.
key_stories.key_quote: Yes, I'm going to be using my own game as inspiration. What you gonna do about it?

key_stories.title: Haircut Mishap
key_stories.summary: A personal incident reveals home life dynamics: Zeina accidentally shaved a strip of Kaze's hair, forcing a drastic cut.
key_stories.process: Finished cut short to hide bald line.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze streams with unexpected ‘military’ cut, providing light-hearted context.
key_stories.key_quote: Because my wife fucked up my haircut.

open_questions.context: Kaze said ‘We still don't know what the boss would be’.
questions: What kind of boss encounter fits the ice-castle theme?
How does the team decide on boss mechanics vs aesthetic?
Who is responsible for modelling/animating the boss?

open_questions.context: Progress is paused until Sauraen makes final calls.
questions: How will Sauraen's choice affect performance or features?
What contingency plans exist if the decision is delayed?

open_questions.context: Kaze confirmed the engine will be open source but gave no timeline.
questions: When and under which licence will the engine be published?
What documentation or tooling will accompany the release?
How does Nintendo’s IP factor into an open-source drop?

open_questions.context: Kaze posted a successful video and rejected ‘just use a death floor’ suggestions.
questions: What design principles guide collision boundaries?
How does he balance challenge with player freedom?
What lessons from Banjo-Tooie influence these decisions?

open_questions.context: Kaze uses ‘random games’ textures while Zeina and Biobak also create assets.
questions: How are external textures vetted for consistency and legality?
What is Zeina’s workflow for signage and environmental art?
How does the team decide when to create vs borrow textures?

open_questions.context: Fixing the S8 crash required removing a risky optimisation.
questions: Are similar register hacks used elsewhere in the codebase?
What testing safeguards prevent this kind of crash resurfacing?
Would formal code review or tooling help catch these issues early?
